The claim that MMS: chlorine dioxide) can be effective in preventing and eradicating the coronavirus is debunked by experts.
MMS is sold online under various names s: Miracle Mineral Supplement, and Master Mineral Solution.
MMS is a combination of sodium chlorite: which when mixed together, produces chlorine dioxide, an industrial bleach.
Promoters of MMS: such as Jordan Sather and Kerri Rivera, falsely claim that it can cure various health conditions including autism, cancer, AIDS, and now the novel coronavirus.
